enums.name: Operator
enums.description: Comparator describes the type of comparison.

values.name: OPERATOR_UNSPECIFIED
values.description: The default value

values.name: OPERATOR_EQUALS
values.description: Verify if the property values are strictly equal or not.

values.name: OPERATOR_GREATER_THAN
values.description: Verify if the data source data value is greater than the Condition value.

values.name: OPERATOR_GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL
values.description:
Verify if the data source data value is greater than or equal to the Condition
value.

values.name: OPERATOR_LESS_THAN
values.description: Verify if the data source data value is less than the Condition value.

values.name: OPERATOR_LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL
values.description:
Verify if the data source data value is less or equal to than the Condition
value.

enums.name: Type
enums.description:
Type describes the type of properties that are supported by the data source
engine.

values.name: TYPE_UNSPECIFIED
values.description: The default value.

values.name: TYPE_EMPTY
values.description: Any type.

values.name: TYPE_INTEGER
values.description: Integer type.

values.name: TYPE_STRING
values.description: String type.

values.name: TYPE_BOOLEAN
values.description: Boolean type.

values.name: TYPE_DECIMAL
values.description: Any floating point decimal type.

values.name: TYPE_TIMESTAMP
values.description: Timestamp date type.

messages.name: Condition
messages.description: Condition describes the condition that must be validated by the network

fields.name: operator
fields.description: comparator is the type of comparison to make on the value.

fields.name: value
fields.description: value is used by the comparator.

messages.name: Filter
messages.description:
Filter describes the conditions under which a data source data is considered of
interest or not.

fields.name: key
fields.description: key is the data source data property key targeted by the filter.

fields.name: conditions
fields.description:
conditions are the conditions that should be matched by the data to be
considered of interest.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: PropertyKey
messages.description: PropertyKey describes the property key contained in data source data.

fields.name: name
fields.description: name is the name of the property.

fields.name: type
fields.description: type is the type of the property.

fields.name: number_decimal_places
fields.description:
An optional decimal place to be be applied on the provided value
valid only for PropertyType of type DECIMAL and INTEGER
fields.label: optional

messages.name: Data
messages.description:
Data describes valid source data that has been received by the node.
It represents both matched and unmatched data.

fields.name: data
fields.description: data holds all the properties of the data
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: matched_spec_ids
fields.description:
matched_specs_ids lists all the specs that matched this data.
When the array is empty, it means no spec matched this data.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: broadcast_at
fields.description:
broadcast_at is the time at which the data was broadcast to the markets
with a matching spec.
It has no value when the date did not match any spec.
The value is a Unix timestamp in nanoseconds.

messages.name: Property
messages.description: Property describes one property of data spec with a key with its value.

fields.name: name
fields.description: name is the name of the property.

fields.name: value
fields.description: value is the value of the property.

fields.name: number_decimal_places
fields.description:
An optional decimal place to be be applied on the provided value
valid only for PropertyType of type DECIMAL and INTEGER
fields.label: optional

messages.name: PubKey
messages.description:
PubKey is the public key that signed this data.
Different public keys coming from different sources will be further separated.

fields.name: pub_key
fields.description:
pubKeys is the list of authorized public keys that signed the data for this
source. All the public keys in the data should be contained in these
public keys.

fields.name: eth_address
fields.description: in case of an open oracle - Ethereum address will be submitted

enums.name: Status
enums.description: Status describe the status of the data source spec

values.name: STATUS_UNSPECIFIED
values.description: The default value.

values.name: STATUS_ACTIVE
values.description: STATUS_ACTIVE describes an active data source spec.

values.name: STATUS_DEACTIVATED
values.description:
STATUS_DEACTIVATED describes an data source spec that is not listening to data
anymore.

messages.name: DataSourceDefinition
messages.description:
DataSourceDefinition represents the top level object that deals with data sources.
DataSourceDefinition can be external or internal, with whatever number of data sources are defined
for each type in the child objects below.

messages.name: DataSourceDefinitionExternal
messages.description:
DataSourceDefinitionExternal is the top level object used for all external data sources.
It contains one of any of the defined `SourceType` variants.

messages.name: DataSourceDefinitionInternal
messages.description:
DataSourceDefinitionInternal is the top level object used for all internal data sources.
It contains one of any of the defined `SourceType` variants.

messages.name: DataSourceSpec
messages.description:
A data source spec describes the data source base that a product (or a risk model)
wants to get from the data source engine.
This message contains additional information used by the API.

fields.name: id
fields.description: id is a hash generated from the DataSpec data.

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: Creation Date time

fields.name: updated_at
fields.description: Last Updated timestamp

fields.name: status
fields.description: status describes the status of the data source spec

messages.name: DataSourceSpecConfiguration
messages.description:
All types of external data sources use the same configuration set for meeting requirements
in order for the data to be useful for Vega - valid signatures and matching filters.

fields.name: signers
fields.description:
signers is the list of authorized signatures that signed the data for this
source. All the signatures in the data source data should be contained in this
external source. All the signatures in the data should be contained in this list.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: filters
fields.description:
filters describes which source data are considered of interest or not for
the product (or the risk model).
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: DataSourceSpecConfigurationTime
messages.description: DataSourceSpecConfigurationTime is the internal data source used for emitting timestamps.

fields.name: conditions
fields.description: Conditions that the timestamps should meet in order to be considered.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: AuctionDuration
messages.description:
An auction duration is used to configure 3 auction periods:
1. `duration > 0`, `volume == 0`:
  The auction will last for at least N seconds
2. `duration == 0`, `volume > 0`:
  The auction will end once the given volume will match at uncrossing
3. `duration > 0`, `volume > 0`:
  The auction will take at least N seconds, but can end sooner if the market can trade a certain volume

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Duration of the auction in seconds

fields.name: volume
fields.description: Target uncrossing trading volume

messages.name: DataSourceSpecToFutureBinding
messages.description:
DataSourceSpecToFutureBinding describes which property of the data source data is to be
used as settlement data and which to use as the trading terminated trigger

fields.name: settlement_data_property
fields.description:
settlement_data_property holds the name of the property in the source data
that should be used as settlement data.
If it is set to "prices.BTC.value", then the Future will use the value of
this property as settlement data.

fields.name: trading_termination_property
fields.description: the name of the property in the data source data that signals termination of trading

enums.name: AccountType
enums.description: Various collateral/account types as used by Vega

values.name: ACCOUNT_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED
values.description: Default value

values.name: ACCOUNT_TYPE_INSURANCE
values.description: Insurance pool accounts contain insurance pool funds for a market

values.name: ACCOUNT_TYPE_SETTLEMENT
values.description: Settlement accounts exist only during settlement or mark-to-market

values.name: ACCOUNT_TYPE_MARGIN
values.description:
Margin accounts contain funds set aside for the margin needed to support a party's open positions.
Each party will have a margin account for each market they have traded in.
The required initial margin is allocated to each market from your general account.
Collateral in the margin account can't be withdrawn or used as margin on another market until
it is released back to the general account.
The Vega protocol uses an internal accounting system to segregate funds held as
margin from other funds to ensure they are never lost or 'double spent'

Margin account funds will vary as margin requirements on positions change

values.name: ACCOUNT_TYPE_GENERAL
values.description:
General accounts contain the collateral for a party that is not otherwise allocated. A party will
have multiple general accounts, one for each asset they want
to trade with

General accounts are where funds are initially deposited or withdrawn from,
it is also the account where funds are taken to fulfil fees and initial margin requirements

values.name: ACCOUNT_TYPE_FEES_INFRASTRUCTURE
values.description: Infrastructure accounts contain fees earned by providing infrastructure on Vega

values.name: ACCOUNT_TYPE_FEES_LIQUIDITY
values.description: Liquidity accounts contain fees earned by providing liquidity on Vega markets

values.name: ACCOUNT_TYPE_FEES_MAKER
values.description:
This account is created to hold fees earned by placing orders that sit on the book
and are then matched with an incoming order to create a trade - These fees reward parties
who provide the best priced liquidity that actually allows trading to take place

values.name: ACCOUNT_TYPE_BOND
values.description: This account is created to maintain liquidity providers funds commitments

values.name: ACCOUNT_TYPE_EXTERNAL
values.description: External account represents an external source (deposit/withdrawal)

values.name: ACCOUNT_TYPE_GLOBAL_INSURANCE
values.description: Global insurance account for the asset

values.name: ACCOUNT_TYPE_GLOBAL_REWARD
values.description: Global reward account for the asset

values.name: ACCOUNT_TYPE_PENDING_TRANSFERS
values.description: Per asset account used to store pending transfers (if any)

values.name: ACCOUNT_TYPE_REWARD_MAKER_PAID_FEES
values.description: Per asset reward account for fees paid to makers

values.name: ACCOUNT_TYPE_REWARD_MAKER_RECEIVED_FEES
values.description: Per asset reward account for fees received by makers

values.name: ACCOUNT_TYPE_REWARD_LP_RECEIVED_FEES
values.description: Per asset reward account for fees received by liquidity providers

values.name: ACCOUNT_TYPE_REWARD_MARKET_PROPOSERS
values.description: Per asset reward account for market proposers when the market goes above some trading threshold

enums.name: Status
enums.description: Status of a liquidity provision order

values.name: STATUS_UNSPECIFIED
values.description: The default value

values.name: STATUS_ACTIVE
values.description: The liquidity provision is active

values.name: STATUS_STOPPED
values.description: The liquidity provision was stopped by the network

values.name: STATUS_CANCELLED
values.description: The liquidity provision was cancelled by the liquidity provider

values.name: STATUS_REJECTED
values.description: The liquidity provision was invalid and got rejected

values.name: STATUS_UNDEPLOYED
values.description: The liquidity provision is valid and accepted by network, but orders aren't deployed

values.name: STATUS_PENDING
values.description:
The liquidity provision is valid and accepted by network
but has never been deployed. If when it's possible to deploy the orders for the first time
margin check fails, then they will be cancelled without any penalties.

enums.name: Status
enums.description: Status values for an order

values.name: STATUS_UNSPECIFIED
values.description: Default value, always invalid

values.name: STATUS_ACTIVE
values.description: Used for active unfilled or partially filled orders

values.name: STATUS_EXPIRED
values.description: Used for expired GTT orders

values.name: STATUS_CANCELLED
values.description: Used for orders cancelled by the party that created the order

values.name: STATUS_STOPPED
values.description: Used for unfilled FOK or IOC orders, and for orders that were stopped by the network

values.name: STATUS_FILLED
values.description: Used for closed fully filled orders

values.name: STATUS_REJECTED
values.description: Used for orders when not enough collateral was available to fill the margin requirements

values.name: STATUS_PARTIALLY_FILLED
values.description: Used for closed partially filled IOC orders

values.name: STATUS_PARKED
values.description:
Order has been removed from the order book and has been parked,
this applies to pegged orders and liquidity orders (orders created from a liquidity provision shape)

enums.name: TimeInForce
enums.description: Time In Force for an order

values.name: TIME_IN_FORCE_UNSPECIFIED
values.description: Default value for TimeInForce, can be valid for an amend

values.name: TIME_IN_FORCE_GTC
values.description:
Good until cancelled, the order trades any amount and as much as possible
and remains on the book until it either trades completely or is cancelled

values.name: TIME_IN_FORCE_GTT
values.description:
Good until specified time, this order type trades any amount and as much as possible
and remains on the book until it either trades completely, is cancelled, or expires at a set time
NOTE: this may in future be multiple types or have sub types for orders that provide different ways of specifying expiry

values.name: TIME_IN_FORCE_IOC
values.description:
Immediate or cancel, the order trades any amount and as much as possible
but does not remain on the book (whether it trades or not)

values.name: TIME_IN_FORCE_FOK
values.description:
Fill or kill, The order either trades completely (remainingSize == 0 after adding)
or not at all, does not remain on the book if it doesn't trade

values.name: TIME_IN_FORCE_GFA
values.description: Good for auction, this order is only accepted during an auction period

values.name: TIME_IN_FORCE_GFN
values.description: Good for normal, this order is only accepted during normal trading (that can be continuous trading or frequent batched auctions)

enums.name: Type
enums.description: Type values for an order

values.name: TYPE_UNSPECIFIED
values.description: Default value, always invalid

values.name: TYPE_LIMIT
values.description: Used for Limit orders

values.name: TYPE_MARKET
values.description: Used for Market orders

values.name: TYPE_NETWORK
values.description: Used for orders where the initiating party is the network (with distressed parties)

enums.name: OrderError
enums.description:
OrderError codes are returned in the `[Order](#vega.Order).reason` field - If there is an issue
with an order during its life-cycle, it will be marked with `status.ORDER_STATUS_REJECTED`

values.name: ORDER_ERROR_UNSPECIFIED
values.description: Default value, no error reported

values.name: ORDER_ERROR_INVALID_MARKET_ID
values.description: Order was submitted for a market that does not exist

values.name: ORDER_ERROR_INVALID_ORDER_ID
values.description: Order was submitted with an invalid identifier

values.name: ORDER_ERROR_OUT_OF_SEQUENCE
values.description: Order was amended with a sequence number that was not previous version + 1

values.name: ORDER_ERROR_INVALID_REMAINING_SIZE
values.description: Order was amended with an invalid remaining size (e.g. remaining greater than total size)

values.name: ORDER_ERROR_TIME_FAILURE
values.description: Node was unable to get Vega (blockchain) time

values.name: ORDER_ERROR_REMOVAL_FAILURE
values.description: Failed to remove an order from the book

values.name: ORDER_ERROR_INVALID_EXPIRATION_DATETIME
values.description:
An order with `TimeInForce.TIME_IN_FORCE_GTT` was submitted or amended
with an expiration that was badly formatted or otherwise invalid

values.name: ORDER_ERROR_INVALID_ORDER_REFERENCE
values.description: Order was submitted or amended with an invalid reference field

values.name: ORDER_ERROR_EDIT_NOT_ALLOWED
values.description: Order amend was submitted for an order field that cannot not be amended (e.g. order identifier)

values.name: ORDER_ERROR_AMEND_FAILURE
values.description: Amend failure because amend details do not match original order

values.name: ORDER_ERROR_NOT_FOUND
values.description: Order not found in an order book or store

values.name: ORDER_ERROR_INVALID_PARTY_ID
values.description: Order was submitted with an invalid or missing party identifier

values.name: ORDER_ERROR_MARKET_CLOSED
values.description: Order was submitted for a market that has closed

values.name: ORDER_ERROR_MARGIN_CHECK_FAILED
values.description: Order was submitted, but the party did not have enough collateral to cover the order

values.name: ORDER_ERROR_MUST_BE_GTT_OR_GTC

values.name: ORDER_ERROR_WITHOUT_REFERENCE_PRICE

enums.name: PeggedReference
enums.description:
A pegged reference defines which price point a pegged order is linked to - meaning
the price for a pegged order is calculated from the value of the reference price point

values.name: PEGGED_REFERENCE_UNSPECIFIED
values.description: Default value for PeggedReference, no reference given

values.name: PEGGED_REFERENCE_MID
values.description: Mid price reference

values.name: PEGGED_REFERENCE_BEST_BID
values.description: Best bid price reference

values.name: PEGGED_REFERENCE_BEST_ASK
values.description: Best ask price reference

enums.name: Side
enums.description: A side relates to the direction of an order, to Buy, or Sell

values.name: SIDE_UNSPECIFIED
values.description: Default value, always invalid

values.name: SIDE_BUY
values.description: Buy order

values.name: SIDE_SELL
values.description: Sell order

enums.name: Type
enums.description: Type values for a trade

values.name: TYPE_UNSPECIFIED
values.description: Default value, always invalid

values.name: TYPE_DEFAULT
values.description: Normal trading between two parties

values.name: TYPE_NETWORK_CLOSE_OUT_GOOD
values.description:
Trading initiated by the network with another party on the book,
which helps to zero-out the positions of one or more distressed parties

values.name: TYPE_NETWORK_CLOSE_OUT_BAD
values.description:
Trading initiated by the network with another party off the book,
with a distressed party in order to zero-out the position of the party

enums.name: TransferType
enums.description: Transfers can occur between parties on Vega, these are the types that indicate why a transfer took place

values.name: TRANSFER_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED
values.description: Default value, always invalid

values.name: TRANSFER_TYPE_LOSS
values.description: Funds deducted after final settlement loss

values.name: TRANSFER_TYPE_WIN
values.description: Funds added to general account after final settlement gain

values.name: TRANSFER_TYPE_MTM_LOSS
values.description: Funds deducted from margin account after mark to market loss

values.name: TRANSFER_TYPE_MTM_WIN
values.description: Funds added to margin account after mark to market gain

values.name: TRANSFER_TYPE_MARGIN_LOW
values.description: Funds transferred from general account to meet margin requirement

values.name: TRANSFER_TYPE_MARGIN_HIGH
values.description: Excess margin amount returned to general account

values.name: TRANSFER_TYPE_MARGIN_CONFISCATED
values.description: Margin confiscated from margin account to fulfil closeout

values.name: TRANSFER_TYPE_MAKER_FEE_PAY
values.description: Maker fee paid from general account

values.name: TRANSFER_TYPE_MAKER_FEE_RECEIVE
values.description: Maker fee received into general account

values.name: TRANSFER_TYPE_INFRASTRUCTURE_FEE_PAY
values.description: Infrastructure fee paid from general account

values.name: TRANSFER_TYPE_INFRASTRUCTURE_FEE_DISTRIBUTE
values.description: Infrastructure fee received into general account

values.name: TRANSFER_TYPE_LIQUIDITY_FEE_PAY
values.description: Liquidity fee paid from general account

values.name: TRANSFER_TYPE_LIQUIDITY_FEE_DISTRIBUTE
values.description: Liquidity fee received into general account

values.name: TRANSFER_TYPE_BOND_LOW
values.description: Bond account funded from general account to meet required bond amount

values.name: TRANSFER_TYPE_BOND_HIGH
values.description: Bond returned to general account after liquidity commitment was reduced

values.name: TRANSFER_TYPE_WITHDRAW
values.description: Funds withdrawn from general account

values.name: TRANSFER_TYPE_DEPOSIT
values.description: Funds deposited to general account

values.name: TRANSFER_TYPE_BOND_SLASHING
values.description: Bond account penalised when liquidity commitment not met

values.name: TRANSFER_TYPE_REWARD_PAYOUT
values.description: Reward payout received

values.name: TRANSFER_TYPE_TRANSFER_FUNDS_SEND
values.description: A network internal instruction for the collateral engine to move funds from a user's general account into the pending transfers pool

values.name: TRANSFER_TYPE_TRANSFER_FUNDS_DISTRIBUTE
values.description: A network internal instruction for the collateral engine to move funds from the pending transfers pool account into the destination account

values.name: TRANSFER_TYPE_CLEAR_ACCOUNT
values.description: Market-related accounts emptied because market has closed

values.name: TRANSFER_TYPE_CHECKPOINT_BALANCE_RESTORE
values.description: Balances restored after network restart

messages.name: Account
messages.description: Represents an account for an asset on Vega for a particular owner or party

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique account identifier (used internally by Vega)

fields.name: owner
fields.description:
The party that the account belongs to, special values include `network`, which represents the Vega network and is
most commonly seen during liquidation of distressed trading positions

fields.name: balance
fields.description:
Balance of the asset, the balance is an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly
formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places
and importantly balances cannot be negative
This field is an unsigned integer passed as a string and needs to be scaled using the asset's decimal places.

fields.name: asset
fields.description: Asset identifier for the account

fields.name: market_id
fields.description: Market identifier for the account, if [`AccountType`](#vega.AccountType).`ACCOUNT_TYPE_GENERAL` this will be empty

fields.name: type
fields.description: The account type related to this account

fields.name: owner
fields.description: not specified if network account
fields.label: optional

fields.name: market_id
fields.description: not specified is account is not related to a market
fields.label: optional

messages.name: AuctionIndicativeState
messages.description: AuctionIndicativeState is used to emit an event with the indicative price/volume per market during an auction

fields.name: market_id
fields.description: The market identifier for which this state relates to

fields.name: indicative_price
fields.description: The Indicative Uncrossing Price is the price at which all trades would occur if the auction uncrossed now

fields.name: indicative_volume
fields.description: The Indicative Uncrossing Volume is the volume available at the Indicative crossing price if the auction uncrossed now

fields.name: auction_start
fields.description: The timestamp at which the auction started

fields.name: auction_end
fields.description: The timestamp at which the auction is meant to stop

messages.name: Candle
messages.description:
Represents the high, low, open, and closing prices for an interval of trading,
referred to commonly as a candlestick or candle

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description:
Timestamp for the point in time when the candle was initially created/opened, in nanoseconds since the epoch
- See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

fields.name: datetime
fields.description: An ISO-8601 datetime with nanosecond precision for when the candle was last updated

fields.name: high
fields.description:
Highest price for trading during the candle interval
This field is an unsigned integer passed as a string and needs to be scaled using the market's decimal places.

fields.name: low
fields.description:
Lowest price for trading during the candle interval
This field is an unsigned integer passed as a string and needs to be scaled using the market's decimal places.

fields.name: open
fields.description:
Open trade price
This field is an unsigned integer passed as a string and needs to be scaled using the market's decimal places.

fields.name: close
fields.description:
Closing trade price
This field is an unsigned integer passed as a string and needs to be scaled using the market's decimal places.

fields.name: volume
fields.description:
Total trading volume during the candle interval
This field is an unsigned integer passed as a string and needs to be scaled using the market's position decimal places.

fields.name: interval
fields.description: Time interval for the candle - See [`Interval`](#vega.Interval)

fields.name: party
fields.description: Party which is delegating

fields.name: node_id
fields.description: Node ID

fields.name: amount
fields.description:
Amount delegated
This field is an unsigned integer passed as a string and needs to be scaled using the asset decimal places of the token.

fields.name: epoch_seq
fields.description: Epoch of delegation

messages.name: EthereumConfig
messages.description: Ethereum configuration details.

fields.name: network_id
fields.description: Network identifier of this Ethereum network.

fields.name: chain_id
fields.description: Chain identifier of this Ethereum network.

fields.name: collateral_bridge_contract
fields.description: Contract configuration of the collateral bridge contract for this Ethereum network.

fields.name: confirmations
fields.description:
Number of block confirmations to wait to consider an Ethereum transaction trusted.
An Ethereum block is trusted when there are at least "n" blocks confirmed by the
network, "n" being the number of `confirmations` required. If `confirmations` was set to `3`,
and the current block to be forged (or mined) on Ethereum is block 14, block
10 would be considered as trusted, but not block 11.

fields.name: staking_bridge_contract
fields.description: Contract configuration of the stacking bridge contract for this Ethereum network.

fields.name: token_vesting_contract
fields.description: Contract configuration of the token vesting contract for this Ethereum network.

fields.name: multisig_control_contract
fields.description: Contract configuration of the multisig control contract for this Ethereum network.

fields.name: address
fields.description: Address of the contract for this Ethereum network. The address should start with "0x".

fields.name: deployment_block_height
fields.description: Block height at which the stacking contract has been deployed for this Ethereum network.

messages.description: Represents data generated by a market when open

fields.name: mark_price
fields.description:
Mark price, as an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly
formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places
This field is an unsigned integer passed as a string and needs to be scaled using the market's decimal places.

fields.name: best_bid_price
fields.description:
Highest price level on an order book for buy orders, as an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly
formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places
This field is an unsigned integer passed as a string and needs to be scaled using the market's decimal places.

fields.name: best_bid_volume
fields.description:
Aggregated volume being bid at the best bid price
This field is an unsigned integer passed as a string and needs to be scaled using the market's position decimal places.

fields.name: best_offer_price
fields.description:
Lowest price level on an order book for offer orders
This field is an unsigned integer passed as a string and needs to be scaled using the market's decimal places.

fields.name: best_offer_volume
fields.description:
Aggregated volume being offered at the best offer price, as an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly
formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places
This field is an unsigned integer passed as a string and needs to be scaled using the market's position decimal places.

fields.name: best_static_bid_price
fields.description:
Highest price on the order book for buy orders not including pegged orders
This field is an unsigned integer passed as a string and needs to be scaled using the market's decimal places.

fields.name: best_static_bid_volume
fields.description:
Total volume at the best static bid price excluding pegged orders
This field is an unsigned integer passed as a string and needs to be scaled using the market's position decimal places.

fields.name: best_static_offer_price
fields.description:
Lowest price on the order book for sell orders not including pegged orders
This field is an unsigned integer passed as a string and needs to be scaled using the market's decimal places.

fields.name: best_static_offer_volume
fields.description:
Total volume at the best static offer price, excluding pegged orders
This field is an unsigned integer passed as a string and needs to be scaled using the market's position decimal places.

fields.name: mid_price
fields.description:
Arithmetic average of the best bid price and best offer price, as an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly
formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places
This field is an unsigned integer passed as a string and needs to be scaled using the market's decimal places.

fields.name: static_mid_price
fields.description:
Arithmetic average of the best static bid price and best static offer price
This field is an unsigned integer passed as a string and needs to be scaled using the market's decimal places.

fields.name: market
fields.description: Market identifier for the data

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: Timestamp at which this mark price was relevant, in nanoseconds since the epoch

fields.name: open_interest

The sum of the size of all positions greater than zero on the market
This field is an unsigned integer passed as a string and needs to be scaled using the market's position decimal places.

fields.name: indicative_volume
fields.description:
Indicative volume (zero if not in auction)
This field is an unsigned integer passed as a string and needs to be scaled using the market's position decimal places.

Targeted stake for the given market
This field is an unsigned integer passed as a string and needs to be scaled using the settlement asset's decimal places.

fields.name: supplied_stake

fields.name: liquidity_provider_fee_share

messages.name: Order
messages.description: An order can be submitted, amended and cancelled on Vega in an attempt to make trades with other parties

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the order (set by the system after consensus)

fields.name: market_id
fields.description: Market identifier for the order

fields.name: party_id
fields.description: Party identifier for the order

fields.name: side
fields.description: Side for the order, e.g. SIDE_BUY or SIDE_SELL

fields.name: price
fields.description:
Price for the order, the price is an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly
formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places
This field is an unsigned integer passed as a string and needs to be scaled using the market's decimal places.

fields.name: size
fields.description:
Size for the order, for example, in a futures market the size equals the number of contracts
This field is an unsigned integer passed as a string and needs to be scaled using the market's position decimal places.

fields.name: remaining
fields.description:
Size remaining, when this reaches 0 then the order is fully filled and status becomes STATUS_FILLED
This field is an unsigned integer passed as a string and needs to be scaled using the market's position decimal places.

fields.name: time_in_force
fields.description:
Time in force indicates how long an order will remain active before it is executed or expires.
- See OrderTimeInForce

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type for the order - See OrderType

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: Timestamp for when the order was created at, in nanoseconds since the epoch

fields.name: status
fields.description:
The current status for the order.
- For detail on `STATUS_REJECTED` please check the OrderError value given in the `reason` field

fields.name: expires_at
fields.description: Timestamp for when the order will expire, in nanoseconds since the epoch

fields.name: reference
fields.description:
Reference given for the order, this is typically used to retrieve an order submitted through consensus
- Currently set internally by the node to return a unique reference identifier for the order submission

fields.name: reason
fields.description:
If the Order `status` is `STATUS_REJECTED` then an OrderError reason will be specified
- The default for this field is `ORDER_ERROR_NONE` which signifies that there were no errors
fields.label: optional

fields.name: updated_at
fields.description:
Timestamp for when the order was last updated, in nanoseconds since the epoch
- See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

fields.name: version
fields.description: The version for the order, initial value is version 1 and is incremented after each successful amend

fields.name: batch_id
fields.description:
Batch identifier for the order, used internally for orders submitted during auctions
to keep track of the auction batch this order falls under (required for fees calculation)

fields.name: pegged_order
fields.description: Pegged order details, used only if the order represents a pegged order.

fields.name: liquidity_provision_id
fields.description: Is this order created as part of a liquidity provision, will be empty if not.

fields.name: post_only
fields.description: Only valid for Limit orders. Cannot be True at the same time as Reduce-Only

fields.name: reduce_only
fields.description:
Only valid for Non-Persistent orders. Cannot be True at the same time as Post-Only.
If set, order will only be executed if the outcome of the trade moves the trader's position closer to 0.

Open volume for the position, value is signed +ve for long and -ve for short

fields.name: realised_pnl
fields.description:
Realised profit and loss for the position, value is signed +ve for long and -ve for short
This field is an unsigned integer passed as a string and needs to be scaled using the market's decimal places.

fields.name: unrealised_pnl
fields.description:
Unrealised profit and loss for the position, value is signed +ve for long and -ve for short
This field is an unsigned integer passed as a string and needs to be scaled using the market's decimal places.

fields.description:
Average entry price for the position, the price is an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly
formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places
This field is an unsigned integer passed as a string and needs to be scaled using the market's decimal places.

fields.description: Timestamp for the latest time the position was updated

fields.description: Position status, indicating whether the party was distressed and had orders cancelled or was closed out.

fields.description:
Volume for the position trade, value is signed +ve for long and -ve for short
This field is an unsigned integer passed as a string and needs to be scaled using the market's position decimal places.

fields.description:
Price for the position trade, the price is an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly
formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places
This field is an unsigned integer passed as a string and needs to be scaled using the market's decimal places.

enums.name: State
enums.description:
Proposal state transition:
Open ->
  - Passed -> Enacted.
  - Passed -> Failed.
  - Declined
Rejected
Proposal can enter Failed state from any other state

values.name: STATE_UNSPECIFIED
values.description: Default value, always invalid

values.name: STATE_FAILED
values.description: Proposal enactment has failed - even though proposal has passed, its execution could not be performed

values.name: STATE_OPEN
values.description: Proposal is open for voting

values.name: STATE_PASSED
values.description: Proposal has gained enough support to be executed

values.name: STATE_REJECTED
values.description: Proposal wasn't accepted (proposal terms failed validation due to wrong configuration or failing to meet network requirements)

values.name: STATE_DECLINED
values.description: Proposal didn't get enough votes (either failing to gain required participation or majority level)

values.name: STATE_ENACTED
values.description: Proposal enacted

values.name: STATE_WAITING_FOR_NODE_VOTE
values.description: Waiting for node validation of the proposal

enums.name: ProposalError
enums.description: A list of possible errors that can cause a proposal to be in state rejected or failed

values.name: PROPOSAL_ERROR_UNSPECIFIED
values.description: Default value

values.name: PROPOSAL_ERROR_CLOSE_TIME_TOO_SOON
values.description: The specified close time is too early based on network parameters

values.name: PROPOSAL_ERROR_CLOSE_TIME_TOO_LATE
values.description: The specified close time is too late based on network parameters

values.name: PROPOSAL_ERROR_ENACT_TIME_TOO_SOON
values.description: The specified enactment time is too early based on network parameters

values.name: PROPOSAL_ERROR_ENACT_TIME_TOO_LATE
values.description: The specified enactment time is too late based on network parameters

values.name: PROPOSAL_ERROR_INSUFFICIENT_TOKENS
values.description: The proposer for this proposal has insufficient tokens

values.name: PROPOSAL_ERROR_INVALID_INSTRUMENT_SECURITY
values.description: The instrument quote name and base name were the same

values.name: PROPOSAL_ERROR_NO_PRODUCT
values.description: The proposal has no product

values.name: PROPOSAL_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_PRODUCT
values.description: The specified product is not supported

values.name: PROPOSAL_ERROR_NO_TRADING_MODE
values.description: The proposal has no trading mode

values.name: PROPOSAL_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_TRADING_MODE
values.description: The proposal has an unsupported trading mode

values.name: PROPOSAL_ERROR_NODE_VALIDATION_FAILED
values.description: The proposal failed node validation

values.name: PROPOSAL_ERROR_MISSING_BUILTIN_ASSET_FIELD
values.description: A field is missing in a builtin asset source

values.name: PROPOSAL_ERROR_MISSING_ERC20_CONTRACT_ADDRESS
values.description: The contract address is missing in the ERC20 asset source

values.name: PROPOSAL_ERROR_INVALID_ASSET
values.description: The asset ID is invalid or does not exist on the Vega network

values.name: PROPOSAL_ERROR_INCOMPATIBLE_TIMESTAMPS
values.description: Proposal terms timestamps are not compatible (Validation < Closing < Enactment)

values.name: PROPOSAL_ERROR_NO_RISK_PARAMETERS
values.description: No risk parameters were specified

values.name: PROPOSAL_ERROR_NETWORK_PARAMETER_INVALID_KEY
values.description: Invalid key in update network parameter proposal

values.name: PROPOSAL_ERROR_NETWORK_PARAMETER_INVALID_VALUE
values.description: Invalid value in update network parameter proposal

values.name: PROPOSAL_ERROR_NETWORK_PARAMETER_VALIDATION_FAILED
values.description: Validation failed for network parameter proposal

values.name: PROPOSAL_ERROR_OPENING_AUCTION_DURATION_TOO_SMALL
values.description: Opening auction duration is less than the network minimum opening auction time

values.name: PROPOSAL_ERROR_OPENING_AUCTION_DURATION_TOO_LARGE
values.description: Opening auction duration is more than the network minimum opening auction time

values.name: PROPOSAL_ERROR_COULD_NOT_INSTANTIATE_MARKET
values.description: Market proposal market could not be instantiated in execution

values.name: PROPOSAL_ERROR_INVALID_FUTURE_PRODUCT
values.description: Market proposal market contained invalid product definition

values.name: PROPOSAL_ERROR_INVALID_RISK_PARAMETER
values.description: Market proposal has invalid risk parameter

values.name: PROPOSAL_ERROR_MAJORITY_THRESHOLD_NOT_REACHED
values.description: Proposal was declined because vote didn't reach the majority threshold required

values.name: PROPOSAL_ERROR_PARTICIPATION_THRESHOLD_NOT_REACHED
values.description: Proposal declined because the participation threshold was not reached

values.name: PROPOSAL_ERROR_INVALID_ASSET_DETAILS
values.description: Asset proposal has invalid asset details

values.name: PROPOSAL_ERROR_UNKNOWN_TYPE
values.description: Proposal is an unknown type

values.name: PROPOSAL_ERROR_UNKNOWN_RISK_PARAMETER_TYPE
values.description: Proposal has an unknown risk parameter type

values.name: PROPOSAL_ERROR_INVALID_FREEFORM
values.description: Validation failed for freeform proposal

values.name: PROPOSAL_ERROR_INSUFFICIENT_EQUITY_LIKE_SHARE
values.description:
The party doesn't have enough equity-like share to propose an update on the market
targeted by the proposal

values.description: The market targeted by the proposal does not exist or is not eligible for modification

values.name: PROPOSAL_ERROR_TOO_MANY_MARKET_DECIMAL_PLACES
values.description: The market proposal decimal place is higher than the market settlement asset decimal places

values.description: The market proposal contains too many price monitoring triggers

messages.name: BatchMarketInstructions
messages.description:
A batch of order instructions.
This command accepts only the following batches of commands
and will be processed in the following order:
- OrderCancellation
- OrderAmendment
- OrderSubmission
The total amount of commands in the batch across all three lists of
instructions is restricted by the following network parameter:
"spam.protection.max.batchSize"

messages.name: OrderAmendment
messages.description:
An order amendment is a request to amend or update an existing order on Vega

The `orderID`, `partyID` and `marketID` fields are used for looking up the order only and cannot be amended by this command

fields.name: order_id
fields.description: Order identifier, this is required to find the order and will not be updated, required field

fields.name: market_id
fields.description: Market identifier, this is required to find the order and will not be updated

fields.name: price
fields.description:
Amend the price for the order if the price value is set, otherwise price will remain unchanged.
This field is an unsigned integer passed as a string and needs to be scaled using the market's decimal places.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: size_delta
fields.description:
Amend the size for the order by the delta specified:
- To reduce the size from the current value set a negative integer value
- To increase the size from the current value, set a positive integer value
- To leave the size unchanged set a value of zero
This field needs to be scaled using the market's position decimal places.

fields.description:
Only valid for Non-Persistent orders. Cannot be True at the same time as Post-Only.
If set, order will only be executed if the outcome of the trade moves the trader's position closer to 0.

values.name: TX_VERSION_V2
values.description: This version requires the proof-of-work added to the transaction.

values.description:

fields.name: nonce
fields.description:
A number to provide uniqueness to prevent accidental replays and,
in combination with `block_height`, deliberate attacks.
A nonce provides uniqueness for otherwise identical transactions,
ensuring that the transaction hash uniquely identifies a specific transaction.
Granted all other fields are equal, the nonce can either be a counter
or generated at random to submit multiple transactions within the same
block (see below), without being identified as replays.
Please note that Protocol Buffers do not have a canonical, unique encoding
and therefore different libraries or binaries may encode the same message
slightly differently, causing a different hash.

fields.name: block_height
fields.description:
The block height at which the transaction was made.
This should be the current block height. The transaction will be valid
from the block and up to the `tolerance` block height.
Example: If the network has a tolerance of 150 blocks and `block_height`
is set to `200`, then the transaction will be valid until block `350`.
Note that a `block_height` that is ahead of the real block height will be
rejected. The tolerance can be queried from the chain's network parameters.
`block_height` prevents replay attacks in conjunction with `nonce` (see above).

messages.name: DateRange
messages.description:
A date range for queries that can return historical data
If only the start_timestamp is provided, results from the given start up to the most current timestamp should be returned.
If only the end_timestamp is provided, results up to the given end should be returned (exclusive).
If both the start_timestamp and end_timestamp are provided, results from within the date range should be returned (exclusive).

fields.description: Optional start timestamp in nanoseconds past the epoch
fields.label: optional

fields.description: Optional end timestamp in nanoseconds past the epoch

Ledger entry filter sets filters on returned set of ledger entries.
Ledger entry data can be filtered by asset ID, market ID, party ID for sending and receiving account, as well as by transfer type.

fields.description:
close_on_account_filters determines whether an entry must have accounts matching both the account_from_filter
and the account_to_filter. If set to 'true', entries must have matches in both filters.
If set to `false`, entries matching only the account_from_filter or the account_to_filter will also be included.

messages.name: ObserveEventBusRequest
messages.description: Request to subscribe to a stream of one or more event types from the Vega event bus

fields.name: type
fields.description: One or more types of event, required field
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: market_id
fields.description: Market ID, optional field

fields.name: party_id
fields.description: Party ID, optional field

fields.name: batch_size
fields.description:
Batch size, optional field -
If not specified, any events received will be sent immediately. If the client is not ready
for the next data-set, data may be dropped a number of times, and eventually the stream is closed.
if specified, the first batch will be sent when ready. To receive the next set of events, the client
must write an `ObserveEventBatch` message on the stream to flush the buffer.
If no message is received in 5 seconds, the stream is closed.
Default: 0, send any and all events when they are available.

messages.name: ObserveEventBusResponse
messages.description: Response to a subscribed stream of events from the Vega event bus

fields.name: events
fields.description: List of events
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: ObserveOrdersRequest
messages.description:
Request to subscribe to a stream of orders

The fields for market identifier and party identifier are optional filters:
If omitted all orders, for all parties on all markets will be returned on the stream
If a market identifier is provided, the orders from that market will be returned on the stream
If a party identifier is provided, the orders from that party will be returned on the stream
Both filters can be combined

fields.name: market_ids
fields.description: Market identifier
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: party_ids
fields.description: Party identifier
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: exclude_liquidity
fields.description: Exclude liquidity
fields.label: optional

methods.name: ListLedgerEntries
methods.description:
Ledger entries list

List ledger entries by asset, market, party, account type and transfer type within the given date range.
This query requests and sums the number of ledger entries from a given subset of accounts, specified via the 'filter' argument.
It returns a time series (implemented as a list of AggregateLedgerEntry structs), with a row for every time
the summed ledger entries of the set of specified accounts changes.
Listed entries should be limited to a single party from each side only. If zero or more than one party is provided
for each of the sides - sending and receiving accounts, the query returns an error.

Entries can be queried by:
  - listing ledger entries with filtering on the sending account (market ID, asset ID, account type)
  - listing ledger entries with filtering on the receiving account (market ID, asset ID, account type)
  - listing ledger entries with filtering on the sending AND receiving account
  - listing ledger entries with filtering on the transfer type (on top of above filters or as a standalone option)

methods.name: ExportLedgerEntries
methods.description:
Export ledger entries records ledger entries to a csv file.
May or may not contain a date range - if no date range is provided, list all records for all times.

Ledger entries can be exported by:
  - export ledger entries for a single party for a given asset within a given time range
  - export ledger entries for a single party for a given asset for all times

methods.name: ListBalanceChanges
methods.description:
Balances

`ListBalanceChanges` queries the change in account balances over a period of time.

An account is defined as a set of (asset_id, type, party_id, market_id).
- Every account has an associated asset and type.
- Certain account types (for example, the global reward pool) do not have an associated party.
  These are denoted by the special party identifier 'network'
- Certain account types do not have an associated market (for example general party accounts).
  These are denoted by the special market identifier '' (the empty string)

`ListBalanceChangesRequest` will return a list of
`(vega_time, asset_id, account_type, party_id, market_id, balance)`
With a row for each block at which a given account's balance changes.

messages.name: ObserveEventBusRequest
messages.description: Request to subscribe to a stream of one or more event types from the Vega event bus

fields.name: type
fields.description: One or more types of event, required field
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: market_id
fields.description: Market identifier, optional field

fields.name: party_id
fields.description: Party identifier, optional field

fields.name: batch_size
fields.description:
Batch size, optional field -
If not specified, any events received will be sent immediately. If the client is not ready
for the next data-set, data may be dropped a number of times, and eventually the stream is closed.
if specified, the first batch will be sent when ready. To receive the next set of events, the client
must write an `ObserveEventBatch` message on the stream to flush the buffer.
If no message is received in 5 seconds, the stream is closed.
Default: 0, send any and all events when they are available.

fields.name: expected_difficulty
fields.description:
This is the minimum required difficulty for the next transaction submitted on this block
if it is possible to submit more transactions on this block, otherwise nil.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: hash_function
fields.description: The hashing function used to calculate the block hash

fields.description: The base difficulty for this block for when transactions seen < tx_per_block

fields.name: tx_per_block
fields.description:
The number of transactions that can have their proof-of-work calculated with this block hash before
either the difficulty increases, or no more transactions can use this block hash

fields.name: increasing_difficulty
fields.description:
Whether or not this block allows for increasing proof-of-work difficulty if the
tx-per-block-hash limit has been reached
